quizzes.question:
Fill in the blank to make this code correct.
[!raw!]
>>> (1 + {0})  ** 2
16
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Exponentiation[/h1]

Besides addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, Python also supports [b]exponentiation[/b], which is the raising of one number to the power of another. This operation is performed using two asterisks.[code format="py"]>>> 2**5
32
>>> 9 ** (1/2)
3.0[/code]

quizzes.question:
What is the result of this code?
>>> 7%(5 // 2)
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Quotient & Remainder [/h1]

To determine the [b]quotient [/b]and [b]remainder [/b]of a division, use the [b]floor division[/b] and [b]modulo [/b]operators, respectively. 
Floor division is done using two forward slashes.
The modulo operator is carried out with a percent symbol (%). 
These operators can be used with both floats and integers.

This code shows that 6 goes into 20 three times, and the remainder when 1.25 is divided by 0.5 is 0.25. [code format="py"]>>> 20 // 6
3
>>> 1.25 % 0.5
0.25[/code]
